about.smartdrive-serial-number-info: To access your SmartDrive Serial Number, which can be useful for support and warranty purposes, you must connect to the PushTracker Mobile app.
about.title: About Information
about.version: SmartDrive MX2+ Wear OS App (SW) Version

2_0: Added ability to view most recent SmartDrive Bluetooth connection strength to the "About" Settings Menu
Added support for sending and receiving SmartDrive SwitchControl configurations to / from PushTracker Mobile app and SmartDrive

Added dynamic SwitchControl button indication so button LED(s) indicate power assist and driving state
 - If PushTracker / E2 is connected and / or switch control is enabled LED(s) will flash in different patterns.
 - If motor is driving LED(s) will be solid.

SmartDrive can be configured to Momentary or Latched SwitchControl Modes
 - In the default Momentary Mode the SmartDrive will start driving the motor by ramping up its speed to the configured SwitchControl Max Speed only while one of the buttons is being held.
 - In Latched Mode, the SmartDrive will start ramping up its speed to the configured SwitchControl Max Speed while one of the buttons is being held. When the held button is released, the SmartDrive will remain driving at the current speed. Deactivate the driving by pressing a button.
SmartDrive SwitchControl has its own configurable Max Speed setting which is independent of the Max Speed setting for the PushTracker / E2

SmartDrive is now configured to beep once whenever its state is changed to power assist ON
 - This state change can be from a PushTracker / E2 and SwitchControl button(s).
 - This indication setting can be disabled either through the SmartDrive MX2+ app on your PushTracker E2 or using the PushTracker Mobile app on your smartphone if you do not have an E2.

error-history.no-errors: No SmartDrive errors have been recorded or received.
error-history.title: SmartDrive Error History

app-connection.logout: Account has been logged out. Reconnection to PushTracker Mobile app required.

failures.downloading-translations: Failed to download the updated language files.
failures.must-wear-watch: [Check for Wrist] Setting is enabled, therefore the smartwatch must be worn to control your SmartDrive.
failures.no-network: Connection to the cloud is not available. Ensure your smartwatch is connected to the internet either through Wi-Fi or your phone.
failures.permissions: Unable to perform the requested action. Required permissions were not granted.
failures.power-assist-timeout: To help conserve battery, power assist was automatically turned OFF due to inactivity. See "Power Assist Timeout" in SmartDrive Settings Menu for more information.
failures.send-settings: Failed to send settings to SmartDrive.
failures.title: Notice
failures.too-many-smartdrives-found: Multiple SmartDrives found. Make sure there is only one SmartDrive on in the vicinity when pairing.

notifications.tire-pressure: Tire pressure greatly impacts your ability to push. Have you checked it lately?
notifications.sd-roller-check: Check your rollers.  See flat spots? Are they hard to spin? Contact SmartDrive today to discuss.
notifications.sd-clamp-check: Time to check your alignment! Make sure your clamp or folding frame adapter are set correct. Refer to your user’s manual or contact us.
notifications.open-pt-wear: Want to know more about your daily mobility? Open the PushTracker app to know your push count, coast time, and distance traveled each day.
notifications.access-more-features: Want more features about your daily/weekly/monthly propulsion activities? Contact us to learn how to make your PushTracker E2 give your more features!
notifications.unlock-more-features: Unlock more E2! Text messages, heart rate, and calendar alerts are just few other features you can get from your PushTracker E2. Refer to the instructions on your E2 box or contact us to learn how to make your PushTracker E2 give your more features!
notifications.daily-distance-record: You did it! You achieved a new personal record for distance traveled in a day. Keep it up! And don’t forget to coast. #ChooseToDoMore
notifications.switch-control-reminder: SwitchControl buttons give you another way to control your SmartDrive. Plug them directly in to SmartDrive charging port (no Bluetooth required). Press the button to go, stop, or set your speed. Contact you provider or SmartDrive support to learn more.
notifications.accelerate-while-moving: Pick up your speed while you’re already moving! Push the wheel to go faster, then single tap with your PushTracker E2. Press and hold SwitchControl to increase speed again.
notifications.sc-light-indications: Curious about the flashing lights are on your SwitchControl? Refer to your user manual or our YouTube page to find out what each one means.
notifications.sd-e2-charging: For optimal performance charge your SmartDrive every night. Make sure you keep it charged above 25%, especially if you’re not going to use SmartDrive for a long time period. Check your user’s manual or contact us for details.
notifications.odometer-records-part-one: Doing more while keeping your shoulders healthy is what it’s all about. You’ve put
notifications.routine-maintenance: Keeping your equipment clean helps it last longer! Use a damp sponge, mild detergent and dry thoroughly to keep your SmartDrive like new! (do not soak or immerse).

state.already-uptodate: Already up-to-date. Select Force to update anyway.

permissions-reasons.coarse-location: To control your SmartDrive using Bluetooth we require you to allow the Location permission [ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION] on the following screen. From this permission Permobil will not be accessing your location data.
permissions-reasons.phone-state: OPTIONAL: To access your smartwatch Serial Number, which can be useful for support and warranty purposes, we need you to allow the Phone permission [READ_PHONE_STATE] on one of the following screens. From this permission Permobil will not be accessing your phone number, cellular network information, or any other data except the smartwatch serial number.

description.acceleration: The acceleration or speed ramp rate of the SmartDrive.
description.controlmode:
MX2+: The default, gesture based operation of the SmartDrive. In MX2+ Control Mode, a double tap will start driving the motor by ramping up its speed, a single tap will coast at the current speed, and a double tap will deactivate the driving.

MX2: In MX2 Control Mode, the SmartDrive will start driving when it senses your push, and will deactivate driving when you tap. Please note this is a legacy-support option.

MX1: In MX1 Control Mode, the SmartDrive will start driving when it senses your push, and will stop driving when you tap or when you brake on the handrims. Please note this is a legacy-support option.
description.language: The language of the text in the SmartDrive app.
description.maxspeed: The maximum speed the SmartDrive can drive at when controlled by your smartwatch.
description.powerassistbuzzer: When enabled, the SmartDrive will beep any time a connection from a remote device is established, or when SwitchControl is taken out of the standby state.
description.powerassisttimeout:
When connected to the SmartDrive with power assist ON, if the motor hasn't been driven in the selected amount of time it will automatically turn power assist OFF. 

If power assist is ON but it is not connected to the SmartDrive, it will automatically turn power assist OFF after 1 minute.
description.switchcontrolmode:
Momentary: The default SwitchControl Mode in which the SmartDrive will start driving the motor by ramping up its speed to the configured SwitchControl Max Speed only while one of the SwitchControl Buttons is being held. When the held Button is released, or both of the Buttons [if present] are pressed, the driving will deactivate. Please note that upon deactivation it does not put the device in the standby state.

Latched: In Latched SwitchControl Mode, the SmartDrive will start driving the motor by ramping up its speed to the configured SwitchControl Max Speed while one of the SwitchControl buttons is being held. When the held button is released, the SmartDrive will remain driving / coast at the current speed when the button was released. When one of the Buttons is pressed and released again, or both of the Buttons [if present] are pressed, the driving will deactivate. Please note that upon deactivation it does not put the device in the standby state.
description.switchcontrolspeed: The maximum speed the SmartDrive can drive at when controlled by SwitchControl.
description.tapsensitivity: The sensitivity of the tap gesture used for activating and deactivating the driving. The lower the percentage is the harder you need to tap - 100% is the most sensitive and therefore easiest to tap, and 10% is the least sensitive and therefore hardest to tap.
description.units: The unit system or units of measure to display the speed and distances within the user interfaces. Select either Imperial [mi and mph] or Metric [km and km/h].
description.wearcheck: When enabled, the smartwatch must be on the wrist to turn power assist ON. If power assist is ON and the smartwatch senses that it is no longer on the wrist, it will automatically turn power assist OFF.

settings.scanning: Scanning for SmartDrive to pair with...
settings.title: SmartDrive Settings

updates.communications-failed: Communications with the SmartDrive have failed, please reboot your SmartDrive.

errors.connection-failure:
Connection to Permobil server failed. Ensure your smartwatch is connected to the internet either through Wi-Fi or your phone.
